alert.note: Alert for Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued October 06 at 2:00PM MST until October 06 at 2:30PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A DUST STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM MST FOR WEST CENTRAL YUMA COUNTY... At 200 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from Araby to 9 miles east of Somerton to 13 miles east of San Luis, moving west at 15 mph. HAZARD...Less than one quarter mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 1 and 9. AZ Route 195 between mile markers 5 and 26. Locations impacted include... Yuma, Somerton, Gadsden, San Luis and Araby. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, then pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
